definition: to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]

sentences.english: You delight to fish in troubled waters.
Never fish in problem runing waterdrop.
Beware of those who fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 小心那些混水摸鱼的人。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他们所要做的就是挑拨离间，混水摸鱼。

sentences.english: This examination will be strictly carried out, so there is no chance to fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 这次考核非常严格，没有混水摸鱼的可能。

sentences.english: Someone fishes in troubled water, empress Yi bow the Lue arrived air.
sentences.chinese: 有人混水摸鱼，将后羿弓掠到了空中。

sentences.english: They love to fish in troubled waters.
Never fish in trouble runing runing water.

definition: to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
